title: The Global Middle Ages
description: Examination of texts from the global Middle Ages in a range of world cultures and traditions, with attention to their historical and social contexts. Course topic changes; please see the Class Search for the current topic. Satisfies the Global and Pre- and Early Modern distribution requirements. May be repeated for credit.
class_notes: **** Topic: At age 17, the young Venetian merchant Marco Polo set out for the court of Qubilai Khan. Twenty-eight years later, he co-authored a work called The Description of the World (misleadingly known today as ?The Travels?). This course takes The Description as a lens through which to explore the Asian and Indian Ocean cultures in the vibrant half-century, 1250-1300. ****
